item.title: Hide details until needed
item.description: Effective web design is often a balancing act between engaging experiences and practical content. You want to provide visual delight to those willing to partake without alienating those who prefer to avoid unwanted distractions. An effective compromise is to hide certain elements until the user choose to view them. The <details> element lets you do this. By default, it hides content until opened by the user. Because <details> is a core HTML element, most browsers implement it in a way that lets those using alternate browsing experiences, such as screen readers, know what’s going on and how to interact with the content.
